text: The 2019 Latvian Higher League was the 28th season of top-tier football in Latvia. The season began on 9 March 2019 and ended on 9 November 2019. Riga were the defending champions from the previous season. ==Teams== All eight clubs from the previous season remained in the league with Daugavpils joining the league as champions of 1.Liga 2018. {| class="wikitable sortable" !Club !Location !Stadium !Capacity |- |BFC Daugavpils |Daugavpils |Celtnieks Stadium |align="center"|4,070 |- |FK Jelgava |Jelgava |Olympic Sports Center of Zemgale |align="center"|1,560 |- |FK Liepāja |Liepāja |Daugava Stadium |align="center"|5,008 |- |FK Metta/LU |Riga |Hanzas vidusskolas laukums |align="center"|2,000 |- |Riga FC |Riga |Skonto Stadium |align="center"|8,207 |- |FK RFS |Riga |Stadions Arkādija |align="center"|1,000 |- |FK Spartaks Jūrmala |Jūrmala |Slokas Stadium |align="center"|2,800 |- |FK Valmiera Glass ViA |Valmiera |J. Daliņa stadions |align="center"|2,000 |- |FK Ventspils |Ventspils |Ventspils Olimpiskais Stadions |align="center"|3,044 |} ==League table== ==Results== Each club played the other eight clubs home-and-away twice, for a total of 32 matches each. ==Relegation play-offs== The ninth- placed team from the 2019 Higher League played the runners-up of the 2019 Latvian First League in a two-legged play-off on 13–16 November 2019. The winner, METTA/LU, will remain in the Latvian Higher League. ==Statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |1 |align="left"| Darko Lemajić |align="left"|Riga |15 |- |2 |align="left"| Tosin Aiyegun |align="left"|Ventspils |11 |- |rowspan="2"|3 |align="left"| Nemanja Belaković |align="left"|Spartaks Jūrmala |rowspan="2"|10 |- |align="left"| Tamirlan Dzhamalutdinov |align="left"|METTA/LU |- |rowspan="2"|5 |align="left"| Tomáš Šimkovič |align="left"|RFS |rowspan="2"|8 |- |align="left"| Vugar Asgarov |align="left"|BFC Daugavpils |- |rowspan="2"|7 |align="left"| Tolu Arokodare |align="left"|Valmiera |rowspan="2"|7 |- |align="left"| Jānis Ikaunieks |align="left"|Liepāja |- |rowspan="5"|9 |align="left"| Roman Debelko |align="left"|Riga |rowspan="5"|6 |- |align="left"| Tomáš Malec |align="left"|RFS |- |align="left"| Kgotso Masangane |align="left"|METTA/LU |- |align="left"| Amâncio Fortes |align="left"|Liepāja |- |align="left"| Daniils Ulimbaševs |align="left"|Ventspils |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Latvian Higher League seasons 1 Latvia Latvia
